inn1.comm: 143kph, back of a length delivery to start off and it carries delightfully through to around Ramdin's chest

that shows off the outfield! Barely a push through point and both deep third man and point are only spectators no matter the effort they put in. It's a downward slope down there and de Kock simply rode on Taylor's pace
he's getting some appealing bounce off this hard, dry deck and de Kock, as Taylor had hoped for, is tucked up. Shortish ball thuds into his gloves as he attempted to flick
offcutter was that? Pitched it up a bit more that time and drew the ball quite wide of de Kock's reach, so he doesn't fish. But it was still inside the tram lines

a touch overpitched and de Kock caresses it all the way to the cover boundary. And I can't stress that enough, caressed it. SCG's outfield is having some fun! Samuels chased after it, got the big boot out before the ball hit the advertising cushions, but the ball still had enough momentum to go on
magnificent work from Simmons, that had four written on it the moment de Kock pressed forward to the wide, fuller ball and tapped to the right of cover
back of a length and in the off-stump corridor, Amla seems to jump before he blocks
a touch closer on off stump and Amla's exaggerated back and across movement gets him in line

might have missed out there, it was short and wide enough for Amla to play the shot he did - a cut - but he mistimes the ball into the covers. Came off the pitch a little slower than he expected, I think

cut him in half! Got the ball to move in off the deck quite alarmingly and Amla was in no position to play that. Very late in bringing the bat straighter from the flick he had been going for and is beaten
shortish and a shade outside off, ridden to point
quite full on off stump, eased to the man at a widish mid-off
cramps him for room as Taylor brings the ball into the left-hander, de Kock doesn't commit too early and adjusts to it
back of a length on middle and off, nudged towards midwicket
that's banged in short and he keeps it around the sixth stump and adds a lot of bounce to ensure the batsman can't take advantage. de Kock did attempt to lift it over the slips, but fails to connect
he's skidding off the deck quite sharply, this is 147 kph, and de Kock is caught on the crease with a flick and wears a bruise on his back thigh
good length ball on off stump, de Kock blocks it
pitches it right up and it curls in through the air, de Kock's angled face means he can only get an inside edge into the square leg region
good length ball outside off, Amla defends carefully
slips away down the leg side and it doesn't help Holder that he's targeted the inswinger to pitch on leg stump and move further away. Great take from Ramdin, leaping to his left
a little short and a little wide, Amla fails to pierce the gap at cover with his cut
good length ball slipping down leg as Amla attempts a flick, Holder appeals after beating the bat for a leg-before but that was going down
good length on off stump, defended
employs half a bat again and this time the inside edge wanders all the way to the fine leg boundary. This is a clever plan to de Kock, cutting his room and testing his ability to play straight.
back of a length on off stump, de Kock blocks towards point
quite easy for Amla when it's overpitched. All he does is bring down that bat after a little whirl and thumps it down the ground. Mid-off though manages to catch up with it
got into the drive on the up a bit too early - not to mention his relative lack of footwork - and the good length ball at 143kph squirts away off the inside edge through square leg
120kph, keeps the length full and on middle with the offcutter, Amla prefers to block it out.
switches his length to the short variety, at 145 kph, and it's on target too. Sails right over a ducking Amla and off stump

shortish on middle and leg, Amla gets across to flick off his hips but he's into the shot again - the two-paced nature of the pitch that was predicted - hits the inside edge and then pops up off the back of the bat again. But it falls quite safe from the lone slip
nudged off his hips very properly to Simmons at midwicket this time
shortish on and around off stump, and de Kock is unable to get out of this strangle he's in. Tapped towards point
good length ball coming into him on off stump, de Kock defends and his inside edge is battered again
good length and a shade outside off, de Kock does a little better to play late and slide the ball to backward point

the pressure has shown! West Indies erupt and Holder is right to celebrate his plan and the execution of it. de Kock sees a shortish ball and thinks he has his release. Goes for the cut and picks out the man at cover. Just a bit more bounce, not quite as much room as he thought. Beautiful game plan from West Indies
back of a length and outside off, Faf gets across on off stump and leaves
considerable carry to Holder as he finishes off a wicket-maiden with a back of a length delivery outside off that is left alone. Third over of dots of the match so far, which is only six overs old
banged in short, way too short and Amla allows it to pass over him to collect the extra

shortish and outside off, but Amla tries to get the better of it with those spectacular wrists. Goes for a whip and somehow manages to control it decently enough to square leg. That ball was bouncing, mind you
opens the face on impact with a back of a length delivery outside off and Amla picks up a couple as Russell sprints after it from cover
gets across on off stump and is struck on the pads while he was trying to clip it off his knees. Taylor thinks of an appeal and by that time the umpire informs him that it's going down

back of a length on off stump, Amla is in line behind it and taps it towards midwicket for a single. And he realises he's running with only one shoe on! Left the other one at the crease and Faf brings it to him with a big smile
solid stroke through Gayle, who cannot get down fast enough to stop the drive from slipping past him at short cover. West Indies keeping the length right up there to the new bat
change up with the shortish ball tucking him up, Faf blocks
just back of a good length and he clips it into the midwicket region for a quick single
keeps the ball well outside off, and Faf is quite uninterested
back of a length on off stump, whipped to midwicket
shortish and outside off and it gains ample bounce as Holder usually generates, Faf hoists his bat well over his head
got inside the line of this short ball and pulled it quite well to long leg and he's set off straight away for a couple. Intelligent batting to take advantage of a weak fielding effort there

good length ball on off stump, Faf is across and blocks with half a bat, hence the inside edge that almost rolled back onto his stumps. Holder did say at the toss that he didn't mind bowling first, and he's leading by example
141kph, hits the shortish length on and around off stump, defended
129kph, that's the change-up and he's lost control of it. Lobs up a wide, slow half-volley and it's drilled to the left of cover where Russell backs up his bowler sharply
another slower ball and Amla laces a drive to cover again. The ball went 'boom' off the bat, but not into the gap
shortish on middle and leg, Amla swivels on his back foot and pulls to long leg
full and a shade outside off, Faf want the drive to go more extra cover than mid-off. Bat face turned in his hands there and ruined his timing
shortish on and around off stump, Amla gets up on his toes to bunt it down
shortish and outside off, Faf is unable to time his lash through the covers. Batsmen are getting into their strokes a bit earlier than they should, even against the new ball
back of a length and outside off, refuses to play and checks something beyond the sightscreen
back of a length and outside off, blocked
shortish and outside off, punched to short cover where Sammy makes a smart save.
shortish and outside off and he barely reached it with his cut shot. Finds cover point as he makes contact with only the bottom of the bat
shortish on middle and off, clipped straight of midwicket
sliding down leg and Faf gets a little flick towards the left of the keeper. Appears to be off the pad
good length ball on off stump, tapped in front of mid-on and he sets off. Excellent running
gets a thick inside edge as he looks to defend tentatively from the crease. Testing length from Russell around the off stump
he's making the ball dig into the pitch and rear up, Faf's bottom hand flies off the bat as he blocks on off stump
full on off stump, Faf had made to flick but then decides to keep the bat straight and push it to mid-off
can't stray there and Faf whips it wide of mid-on for a couple. Serenely done
goes back and flicks a good length ball from outside off to short midwicket
goes back and whips it to deep midwicket, flatter length, no spin, easy put away
slower through the air and Faf had set up for the scoop way too early. Manages to adjust to the loop on the ball as he waits and plays it over the keeper's extended left hand
quicker pace and shorter length, Faf camps back and clips it to deep square leg
good length on off stump, punched down the ground to Benn at long-on
pushed through fuller on off stump, Faf finds short midwicket
good length hon off stump, worked to midwicket
leaps across well outside off and Amla has managed to clip a ball around the sixth-seventh stump and send it to long leg
full toss outside off, straightforward putaway, and irony strikes as Amla drills it straight to Gayle at short cover
fuller delivery outside off, smeared through the covers and Amla takes the opportunity to pick up a couple. The scoreboard is becoming a little more pretty from the South African point of view
full and wide, Amla laces it to the sweeper

safe! Sulieman Benn appeared to be tracking it, but he pulls out when he realises he had no chance to get under the top edge. Shortish delivery on middle seemed to hurry Faf - it was 143 kph - and his pull shot comes out far too late
looped up outside off, smashed to cover
well flighted delivery on middle, Amla drives calmly to long-off
good length ball arrowed in on middle and leg, defended
pushed through quicker on middle and leg, but Faf's spotted the change it creates in his action, gets deep in his crease and whips it through midwicket
tossed up on leg, Amla's wrists take over as he gives some work for deep midwicket
fuller delivery on off stump, but Faf is happy to stay back and push to mid-on
shortish and outside off, Amla stands and pushes to cover
gets up off his toes and works a back of a length delivery to deep square leg. More evidence of his scarcely believable wrists
shortish and outside off, shoulders arms
hammers it wide of mid-on! First boundary since the fourth over and it comes off a rank short ball and Faf pulls it strongly through the gap

Benn lumbers around, willing himself to get to the ball and the big boot helps. Amla gets down with the full half-volley and slices it through point. Good placement to get it so far to the right of third man
two fours in four balls as Amla benefits from a rank short ball this time. Rocks back and cuts behind point with great authority
goes back and punches a shortish delivery outside off to the sweeper

"two, two, two," Faf yells as he jumps back and drills a punch through extra cover. Simmons is the man there, who slips while getting to the ball and looks a little miffed, May have hurt his strapped fingers in the process
pushed down the ground to long-on
flatter delivery on middle, Amla defends with hard hands
gets down the track and to the pitch of the ball before timing it sweetly thorough midwicket. Some urgency into the innings now and that's drinks
bouncer first ball, too high, called a wide
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to point
full, nearly a half-volley, Samuels puts in a dive in slow motion at mid-on to keep it from going to the fence
slower ball, his bat turns in his hands as intended cover-drive ends up going to midwicket
short and wide, du Plessis looks to cut but the ball is not coming on. He is through the shot early, and ends up playing it back to the bowler
short and wide again, and this time he forces it with a more vertical bat for a couple
bouncer this time, and Amla sways out of its line
not much turn and Faf is able to leap back in his crease and slice the shortish delivery through cover
tossed up on middle, Amla stays beside it and unleashes a drive into the covers
good length ball sliding into the pads, Amla clips to short fine leg

no slip and Amla enjoys a thick outside edge towards deep third man. He's looking to stay leg side of the ball and open up the off side - that time he wanted cover, and could well have been walking back had there been a slip
flighted on off stump, pushed into the covers
tossed up on off stump, Amla belts it to long-off
fuller delivery on middle, clipped to deep midwicket
slower ball on off stump, Faf pushes it past short midwicket, but there is protection on the long-on boundary
opens the face of the good length ball and slices it to deep point. Amla and Faf are rapid between the wickets
fuller delivery on off stump keeps Amla quiet
shortish on off stump, but against Amla it winds up at deep square leg as he flicks

no slip again and a genuine edge from Faf wanders safely to third man. The pitch isn't affording the batsmen any luxury to push or drive on the up, nor is Sammy with his lengths and his change of pace
stays back to a good length ball and drills it to deep point
goes back to punches a good lengt hball through to deep point again
tossed up on middle, gets down the track and pushes it down the ground. Benn's good off his own bowling
eased down the ground as this is flighted on middle and leg
tossed up outside off, Amla makes some room and almost straight-drives it to extra cover
back of a length on middle and off, worked into the gap to the right of midwicket
full and a hint outside off, Amla pushes it back at the bowler
length ball outside off, Amla tries to force it away through extra cover but mistimes it to mid-off
good length ball angled into the pads, Amla nudges it to deep square leg
fuller delivery on off stump, Faf slices it in front of point and sets off
almost a yorker on middle and Amla can only bunt it back at the bowler
shortish and outside off, slapped to deep point
flighted on off stump, driven down the ground to long-off
lovely control of flight from Benn as he brings Faf forward and gets the ball to hold in the pitch and go on with the arm. Hint more bounce as well as it is blocked with one hand
tossed up on off stump, Faf runs down and slaps it back at the bowler who fails to field it
pushes into the off side as he gets forward to the pitch of the ball
reaches outside off and whips a tossed up delivery down to long-on
shortish and outside off, Amla nudges it to to left of short fine leg
fuller delivery on off stump, Faf's straight bat sends it down to long-on
fuller delivery outside off, pushed to mid-off
good length ball outside off, slapped to point
full and outside off, whipped behind square leg
back of a length on off stump, defended
stays put in his crease to make sure he has the room to slap the shortish delivery away to the sweeper
gets down the track and taps a good length delivery to long-on
advances on the bowler and whips a fuller delivery to long-on. Almost yorked himself, but brings up South Africa's hundred
flighted outside off, Faf eases it through the covers
a shade short and Amla had rocked back to cut powerfully, only he can't beat Sammy at point
runs at the bowler and nearly beheads Faf at the other end! Brutal hit from Amla, and Faf did equally well to drop to the floor and then get up to pick up the single to long-on
back of a length and outside off, Amla's wrists give it the marching orders behind square leg
fullish on off stump, pushed down to long-on

hammered! That's his fifty and his average keeps soaring, just like this shot from Amla. Fuller delivery on off stump brings him forward and the lash down the ground gets over the ropes. Long boundaries at the SCG here. That's only his 31st six in over 5000 ODI runs
fuller delivery outside off, drilled into the covers
good length ball on off stump, defended
good length ball turned through the midwicket region
moves back and lifts the shortish ball, that seemed to bounce a touch more and has sent it over the extra cover field. Taylor sends in a rocket throw, but Amla makes his ground
flighted on middle, Faf knocks it into the covers and sets off. Singles are coming a lot more easily now
stays back and rides the extra bounce on a shortish delivery outside off, point is on hand to stop it
quicker and shortish, Amla backs away and cuts only to get an outside edge fine of the short third man fielder. Samuels is quick enough though
flighted on middle, tapped to long-on
down the track and hammers a drive so straight that it hits the stumps with a clunk, single off the ricochet
they've decided on making their own tempo now. Picks up a shortish ball on off stump and pulls it over the leg side field
this is a better shot than Amla's earlier, gets almost to the pitch of a fuller delivery outside off and lifts it over mid-off. Fell only inches behind the boundary. Sublime timing
good length ball on off stump, clipped through midwicket to bring up a well-made fifty. Persevered through the tight bowling and the sluggish pitch
whipped through midwicket as he gets across on off stump to the shortish ball
fuller delivery on off stump, punched to long-on
good length ball outside off, Amla slaps it to mid-off
goes back and clips a flatter delivery from the stumps to deep midwicket
strays on the legs of the batsman and it's Amla too. Easy whip to long leg
slid down the leg side, was he preempting Faf running at him?
flatter and on a length outside off, slashed through point
turns down the leg side and Amla flicks it to the left of deep midwicket - Smith is the man - and he sends a wayward throw which allows the batsmen two
goes back and clips a good length ball to deep midwicket again
short ball sets up for Faf to rock back and pull to Smith at deep midwicket
short and flat and outside off, slapped to deep cover
flighted outside off, Amla reaches out and drives to deep cover
flighted outside off and Faf gets forward, goes down on his knees and scoops it over the keeper
down the track, but Samuels has seen him early and pulled his length back. So Faf has to adjust and can only clip to short fine leg
jumps back, picks up a short ball on off and hammers it over extra cover. Pure, startling power that was set up by his footwork to get himself going outside leg
goes back and clips a good length ball to deep midwicket
goes for a trek down the track and has to rush back into his crease after his flick fails. Ramdin gets across to the ball quite quickly as it wandesrs to his right

what a catch! Things happen when the game is under Gayle's control. A little extra bounce foils Du Plessis' back-away-and-hammer-over-extra-cover stroke and he gets a thick edge. The deflection is considerable, but Ramdin rose with the ball and it sticks in the webbing. Hurt him too, but he'll live with the pain to see a set batsman back
shortish and outside off, cut away to deep point

double-wicket over! Gayle has got the party going again! He tends to go back even when the ball tends to be full, trusts his batspeed to dig himself out of trouble but this time he wasn't quick enough to stop the ball from striking him in front of middle and leg. Flick fails, Gayle dances
good length ball on off stump, defends
picked away off his knees to deep square leg and gets off the mark, and a friendly punch on the shoulder from Gayle
fuller delivery on off stump, AB drives down to long-on and trots back for a second run as well
fuller delivery on off stump, AB defends with soft hands
fuller delivery on off stump, pushed past short midwicket
moves around the wicket to the left-hander. Good length ball pushed towards short cover
opens the face and runs a good length ball off the stumps to Samuels sweeping on the off side boundary
goes deep in his crease and knocks a good length ball into the midwcket region and steals two. Classy placement - took it wide of short midwicket and too close in for deep midwicket
bowls with a slip and its tossed up on off stump, defended
a hint of width and Rossouw capitalises with a scythe through the covers. Looks quite organised against spin as he rocks back to get his power and the running is even better
goes back and punches to the sweeper after making some room
moves leg side of the ball and slices the shortish one to deep point
flighted outside off, tapped to short midwicket
slides down the leg side and AB collects the extra

goes back and punches a good length ball to the bowler's right. Gayle runs after it with all the agility he still has and is blocked up Rossouw. Staring contest ensues and Gayle looks quite menacing at six foot six, but he's just playing around
nudged towards midwicket and AB drags his partner over for a quick single. It's as if he's saying, West Indies, your move. Get me out or I will take this away
fuller delivery on off stump, pushed to long-on
whoa! This wasn't all that bad a ball but Rossouw has planted his front leg forward and slugged it over midwicket. Calculated biff and he's split the gap
short ball and it deserved the tonk it got! Sammy's not looking good anymore. Gives Rossouw an easy put away and the batsman took it with both hands. Can't bowl short and his pace on a slow deck
slower ball on leg stump, tucked to square leg
slower ball on off stump, nudged to long-on
flighted outside off, caressed down the ground to long-on
set up for a reverse swee and Gayle nails a yorker on middle and off. Nearly topples the batsman over
gets low to face the fuller ball and slices it to point. Just a hint of width there
tossed up outside off, driven with the angled bat to hit the gap in the covers
tossed up outside off, eased through the covers
pushes it down the leg side. Gayle's thinking a bit too much here...
that's more like it. Full and flat outside off, slid through point and that will be drinks
good length ball on off stump, defended. Offcutter to start and it holds in the pitch and turns too
back of a length and outside off, Rossouw wants to pull and gets it off the bottom of the bat to mid-on
short offcutter outside off, AB waited and waited and waited before he ramped to deep third man. Not enough pace to get a boundary
back of a length on middle and leg, nudged to long leg
lands a yorker outside off, but Rossouw has managed to stay beside it and slice it to deep third man and they race back for the second

goes short and Rossouw is on it in a flash. Jumps back and unleashes a short-armed pulls with amazing power to the square leg boundary. These two have come in and started playing as it the pitch is a feather bed
slower ball on off stump, clipped to the left of deep midwicket and picks up an easy two
right up there on middle, this time from over the wicket, AB nudges to long-on
fuller delivery outside off, skewed away to deep third man off the open face
full on leg stump, AB presents the straight bat for a single to long-on and chills out at the non-strikers'. It's hot out there, people!

moves around to the left-hander and puts the ball in the blockhole, Rossouw bunts it down to long-on and the lack of timing proves profitable for South Africa because of how fast these two run, And more so how they pounce on the opportunity for an extra run
keeps it very full and very straight, but the angle from around the wicket means he can whip it to deep midwicket

full toss and Rossouw has split the gap in the covers! That's the fifty partnership before you could even blink! Rossouw raised his maiden ODI ton against this same opposition and he's making hay again
moves around the wicket, but it's a full toss again. Cover moves to his left to try and cut off the drive, but it reaches the sweeper

oh dear, he's overstepped and Rossouw has unveiled a neat little late cut too! Taylor has been sucked up into the pressure of the powerplay. It was just a bit too wide and has been worked away very intelligently

free hit has been hammered down the ground, but AB de Villiers can't get out of the way quick enough. Says sorry as he runs past his partner for the single. Decent ball though, full on leg stump to cramp him
slower ball outside off, but it's overpitched and AB helps himself to a stunning straight driven boundary. Might have stopped one from Rossouw in the last ball, but makes up for it immediately
fullish on middle and leg, pushed to long-on
good length ball on off stump, pushed to long-off
slower ball on middle and leg, nudged through mdiwicket
he's batting outside the crease and meets a shortish delivery on off stump with a pat to point
full and outside off, driven to cover on the edge of the circle and they make it through for a single. Beautiful cricket
full toss on off stump, hammered back over the considerably tall Holder. Made a little room to free his arms and pounce all over the attempted yorker gone wrong
full on off stump, but AB stays so exquisitely balanced and threads the field at cover. Beats Gayle on his left and the timing is good enough to almost scorch the turf
fuller delivery on middle, clipped to deep midwicket

lovely work from Taylor, who bowls back of a length and outside off after the batsman had jumped across outside off to flick. Inside edge, deflects off the pad into the off side. Taylor races across to effect a possible run out, but Rossouw has reached, as the third umpire confirms.

full on middle, tapped into the covers for another rapid single and their urgency generates an overthrow as well. The fielder had to lob Rossouw to get to the stumps as well and that hurts his chances
full and sliding down leg, too far down for Ramdin to get to it
full on middle and leg, clipped behind square leg off the inside edge and it's the keeper racing after it again
length on off stump, AB is set up on leg though and he lifts it over cover. Didn't quite get it off the middle though

reaches a fifty with a six and with a stroke that would leave AB in envy! Leaps up off his feet and slaps the wide ball that was was rising quite sharply on top of the bounce and time it stunningly well
good length ball on middle, tickled into the midwicket region
cuts from middle stump and despite three men up on the off side, they've pinched another single. Carter under pressure there
lands a yorker on leg stump and it's squeezed down to long-on
they are hitting some unbelievable sixes! Moves outside leg, picked up a length ball on leg stump and hammers it over extra cover. Sheer magic
full toss on middle and leg, AB says thank you with a whip off his legs to the midwicket boundary. Smiles all around as he hugs Rossouw for the 100 partnership in only 9.5 overs
backs away and cracks a short ball over cover and brings up his fifty. AB has taken hold of the innings. But this was there to be put away
seeks the blockhole on middle and off, but AB is safely beside it and thumps it through extra cover. End of the batting Powerplay, which has for once favoured the batting side: 72 runs for no wickets
down the track to a slower ball on middle, Rossouw pushes to mid-off and runs
fuller delivery outside off, drilled to extra cover
back of a length slower ball on middle and leg, worked behind square leg
fuller delivery outside off, punched to wide mid-off
just a shade short, but AB has seen it early, camped back and pulled with great ferocity. Seemed a slower ball too so he made all the pace himself and hit the gap in front of midwicket
bang! Races down the track and turns a wide length ball into a wider, overpitched half volley and creams it over extra cover. Is he hunting another demolition of a century?
tossed up outside, driven to cover
it's a full toss outside off and Rossouw's in too good a form to miss out. Laced through the covers
flighted in on middle and he sweeps, a little bit of danger in that shot there since he had no room to free the arms, but finds a single to wide long-on
lunges across outside off to pick the gap behind square leg with a powerful sweep. He knows everything that happens on a cricket field, it seems
goes back to a shortish ball outside off and slaps it behind point
backs away outside leg and slices the flat, short ball behind point
fuller delivery outside off, Russouw backs away to mow it over the bowler, but he gets a thick edge through to the keeper. End of the record fourth-wicket partnership for SA in World Cups

fuller delivery on middle and leg, nudged to long-on. And it appears Miller hadn't been ready to face the ball. Had been tapping away looking at his boots and as he looked up he realised Russell was at the popping crease
good length on off stump, defended
moves around the wicket, but loads up a full toss on leg stump. AB whips to deep midwicket
not quite short enough to go for the pull, but that's the stage of the innings we're at. Front foot pull fails as the ball sneaks under the bat
flighted on leg stump and AB has swept it past the short leg fielder. Reaches as far forward as he could to get to the pitch, and also outside the line of the ball to help it on its way
this is good length and AB's still been able to get that front foot across, bend it and sweep it over the short fine leg fielder. It's almost like the length and line of the ball doesn't matter
shortish and outside off, cracked to deep point
down the track and whips a fuller ball to deep midwicket and Miller is up for AB's call of two
fuller delivery slipping down the leg side. Not a bad ploy that considering Miller almost overbalanced
tossed up outside off, punched into the covers. Miller isn't usually the best against spin
goes back to a flatter delivery and clips it to deep square leg
fuller delivery on off stump, tapped to mid-off to raise the South Africa 300 with a "Marry me, Miller" sign somewhere in the crowd
into the blockhole on leg stump, whipped to square leg and he sets off. Throw comes in and even if it had hit direct, AB would have been safe.
back of a length on middle and leg, nudged to square leg
fuller delivery outside off, swiped away to deep midwicket and AB steals another couple.
low full toss on middle and leg, knocked away wide of long-on
taken!!! In the crowd though. It's the AB lap sweep over long leg off a good length ball outside off from a fast bowler to boot!
seeks the wide yorker and Miller is able to tap it to the left of point for a single. Good effort from the fielder as he dives away full length
full and wide, Miller has stepped forward and hammered it away over cover. Smith is running around to his left and just about stops it. That had lots of power behind it
full toss outside off, bunted off the bottom of the bat to long-off and despite AB strugging with his fitness at the moment, he cruises for two
planted his front leg across in front of all three stumps, and Holder to his credit stuck to his plans and nailed the wide yorker. Miller looks at the umpire after flaying and missing, but no wide
full and too far outside off, looks to lift it over cover but can't reach
fuller delivery outside off, punched to long-off

wide full toss might have fetched a wicket, but Gayle has lost it in the sky! Would go down as a drop. Plus he had Carver hovering in his eyeline as well. There appeared to have been no calling. Took the outside half of the bat and shot straight up
good length ball pushed outside off, AB slaps it down the pitch and Russell manages to stick out a handy left hand
runs away miles outside off and one-handed sweeps a fuller ball to the square leg boundary. As if we thought he couldn't get any more outrageous! Russell is just stunned
low full toss on leg stump, clipped to square leg

one-handed stunner, this time from Taylor! And Russell runs to his team-mate and goes onto his knees and bows before him. Fuller delivery on leg stump has been swatted down the ground and it appeared certain to go over the ropes until a scarlet blur came in, leapt up and stuck out a right hand! Amazing effort, and he managed to stay inside the boundary as well.
shortish and outside off, slapped to deep point

good length ball outside off, tapped into the off side and gets a single. Russell is a great fielder off his own bowling and he has a great opportunity to get AB out, but the throw misses the mark at the non-strikers' end. AB wasn't even in the frame
mid-on's inside the circle and AB has carted the fuller ball to the long-on boundary. Stepped forward to the fuller ball and clubbed it. Holder can only smile

second fastest hundred in World Cup history comes up with a six! It was length from around the wicket and AB stood still and unleashed a gold swing. Punches the helmet against his chest. This is a statement and a half after the MCG events. PS - it's a no-ball as well
Free hit slapped to long-off as he goes full and a shade wide of off stump

low full toss outside off and he jumps miles outside off and sweeps it over the fine leg boundary. And it's another no-ball. Captain, this is not the most flattering example. Who said wide yorkers keep batsmen quiet? AB has the cheat code to it

free hit is a full toss on off stump and it's been carted to the square leg boundary. Again that back foot moved outside off, the head stays still and the bat swing is clean. Asks for some more water. Is he doing all this while cramping up?

and then unveils the reverse sweep, as it to check if it's still in working order. It sure is! Fuller delivery on middle, should have been pushed down the ground, instead finds a home in the third ma nboundary

fuller delivery on off stump, AB is going for everything now and has miscued it. This is on Benn, he is running back from mid-off and he throws himself back to try and take it and can't hold on. Can't even get close, misjudged it and that's SA's highest world Cup score

length on middle and invites the AB golf-swing again. Sails over Smith's head at deep midwicket as he follow's it forlornly. What. A. Player! Captain to captain, Thirty four runs off the over, second most in any World Cup
fuller ball on off stump, whipped to deep square leg for a couple
oof! It's not just AB. Camps deep in his crease, gets that bottom hand strength into play and shovels a fuller ball over the long-off boundary and punches gloves with AB, with a growl

fuller ball outside off, squeezes it to mid-on and AB had set off immediately. Realises he has to race back and might have been out had it hit. Instead it becomes an overthrow. West Indies are just caught in a whirlpool and can't stop themselves

back of a length and outside off, AB exhibits a front-foot pull and it hurtles to deep midwicket. Carter is waiting there, he has to move to his left and dive, but the ball bursts through his hands. Should we call that a drop? We have to.

dropped again, I think. Smith is the man, but AB has hammered the leather off this ball. Overpitched outside off goes right at cover and it has too much on it for the fielder. Fifty partnership, and AB has 38 of it
fuller and slower delivery outside off, looks to go over cover but misses
slower delivery outside off, slogs it down to wide long-on
length on middle after he saw AB's back foot move wide outside off, decentish ploy, but he's up against a genius who deposits it in the stands behind square leg.
shortish and outside off, AB sets up with his legs spread and base set and pummels a six over deep midwicket. 400 well on the cards, even AB 150 can't be too far away
clubbed to the long-off boundary! That's his 150 - he had 100 off 52, struck 50 more off 12 balls! Overpitched delivery outside off and AB can hit those in his sleep
length on off stump after going around the wicket and AB gives the crowd behind long-on some catching practice. Fastest 150 in ODIs, it's the highest ODI score in Australia

it had to end this way! Full toss outside off and AB has slog swept him over square leg with pure, breathtaking power. The efficiently of his ball-striking is stunning. Accepts some accolades from Gayle as he walks off.

inn2.comm: crashed past point! A hint of shape away from the batsman, but Smith was balanced and trusted his power to get it past the diving fielder. Miller it was
short on middle and leg, Gayle needs his height to get on top of it and block
didn't have the room he wanted, but Gayle has been given his orders and he sticks to them. Whacks a back of a length delivery over mid-on. No timing, but enough for three
shortish and outside off, knocked into the covers
beats him outside off with his trademark away swing. Looks for a drive when the ball wasn't there for it and is made to look silly by the movement
returns the favor as a fast, back of a length delivery outside off is creamed over deep midwicket. Pressed forward and swiped the ball away in anger. Magnificent timing
thuds into the pads as this good length ball seams in and Gayle and cramps him up. Leg bye to square leg
shortish and sliding down leg, Smith is looking for a pull but it doesn't quite bounce high enough. Another leg bye to square leg

knocked him over! Gayle gave himself too much room and Abbott, to his credit, didn't experiement. Kept it straight and hurts middle stump as the batsman swings and misses. Faf leaps into his bowler's arms and Abbott is beside himself as well

fuller delivery on middle and leg, he's beaten Samuels for pace, struck on the pads and has him buckled over. Seemed very close, and there was a little bit of bat involved as well - but it was after impact with pad. And HawkEye says it's three reds!
sliding down leg as Samuels wants to flick and misses
back of a length and outside off, blocked
more inswing from Abbott and he has Samuels in all sorts of awkward positions. Seems to be skidding off the deck and the batsman just about moved his feet away and brought his bat in line
back of a length delivery on middle and leg, secures a leg bye towards midwicket
140kph, good length ball slips down the leg side. Samuels misses the flick but takes the wide
back of a length on off stump, tapped towards midwicket where Behardien refuses to give away a single
terrific delivery at 143 kph. It was back of a length and leaps away from the bat off the seam. Samuels pushes and is lucky not to edge it. His legs were running away from the ball as well
back of a length on middle, defended
this one stays low and Samuels chews his gum and smiles wryly. It was back of a length and outside off and yet skirts below the bat as he tried to block
shortish and outside off, and this one soars into the keeper's gloves after Samuels leaves
fullish on off stump, Smith steps forward to block
nicely done by Smith as he works a good length ball into the gap at midwicket

both centurions from the last game are out for single-figures. Testing line just outside off and the score they need to chase makes him push at the ball. Healthy outside edge safely pouched by de Kock
short of a length, pitches off, angling away, left alone
another leave outside off as he pitches short of a length and just outside
ends the over with another leave outside off
looks to cut what is just short of a length and is beaten by the extra bounce too
short of a length, coming in, hits his inside edge on the way to the pad. Bowled at 146ks
Steyn reacts late and has dropped Smith. This is short of a length, stops a touch. Smith checks his shot, lobs it back, but Steyn reacts late and in the end is only taking evasive action
bowls short but wide down the leg side, and is called
short of a length, into the pads, tucked away off the hip
on a length, outside off, defended off the front foot
driven on the up, wide of mid0off, gets a single
full, on off, driven to mid-off
short of a length, extra bounce, he has to take the bottom hand off as he defends
driven on the up, from down on a knee, through the covers for a four
swinging in late but ends up too straight and goes for a leg-bye off the toe
pulled away as the ball pitches only slightly short, and he clears square leg in the circle with ease
wide length ball, left alone
gets to ball to jag back in and limit Smith to a flick through to deep midwicket. Decent bounce off the deck too
shortish on off stump, blocked as he gets back in line with it
made him hop on off stump, nudged towards point with soft hands
pitches it up a bit further up and Carter displays good knowledge of his off stump with a charming little leave. That shot seems like a lost toddler in this game though

full on off stump and he goes for a single, a very risky single and Smith would have been gone! Just couldn't get the skates on and he nearly gave up as he saw mid-off take aim at all three stumps. But the firlder- Rossouw - misses and goes to ground in disappointment
back of a length delivery on off stump, punched into the covers
fuller delivery outside off, enjoys a thick outside edge off the drive to third man

dropped by Tahir at mid-on! Did the hard work by getting to the ball and sliding forwards to get his hands under it. But spills it. Hard hands! The ball was a pretty good one too - just back of a length and refusing the swing of his hands - but Smith wants to belt it and mistimes it completely
fuller delivery on off stump, defended

inside edge that evades the stumps! Smith has had a litter of chances in the last couple of balls and he's gotten away with all of them. Amazing lengths from Abbott, keeping it full and right on off stump
fuller delivery on off stump, defended
fullish and this one was angled in, clipped to deep midwicket
shortish and outside off, Smith goes for a pull but mistimes it to square leg
keeps the line tight on the stumps and Smith is unable to make contact with the flick. Morkel's bounce makes the ball thuds into the back pad

picks up the length ball and lifts it coolly over mid-on! He's much better on the front foot and shows it off. West Indies must still build their innings here, net run rates can be very important later on
back of a length on off stump, nudged to Tahir at square leg
keeps to his crease and punches a shortish delivery to point
fuller delivery to entice the drive, out it comes from Carter, but he makes no contact. The angle across the left-hander and the lift Morkel gets is too much
fuller delivery outside off, driven smartly to mid-off
he is violent when the ball is pitched up and has width tagged to it. Plants that front foot like Shane Watson and belts it over mid-on
pulls some pace off it and hits a good length on off stump, slid to point
pushed to mid-on as he gets forward to a fuller ball on off stump
shortish and outside off, Carter is back and across and cuts to gully
shortish and outside off, Carter goes for an ambitious pull but only manages an inside edge to square leg
this is short and a shade outside off, Smith pulls to deep square leg. Seemed to have hit a bit high on the bat there
shortish on off stump, knocked into the covers. Rose up on his toes and played it with soft hands
takes the leading edge and wanders into the covers. This was shortish and rising on Carter who does not connect well with the flick
brings out the pull again, but the sound off the bat is a dull thwack. As it it struck the very bottom of the bat and so it did. Two to deep midwicket.
outside edge flies over the cordon and down to Tahir at deep third man who gets across to his left and dives to stop it

taken by a mid-on running and diving to his left! And guess who it is! Two balls ago Morkel bowled a no-ball that hadn't been picked up the umpire Gould, this time Morkel's foot is where it should be and Carter has to walk off after mistiming another pull shot. The extra bounce, the lack of room to free the arms - it's West Indies' early tactics, only bolstered by scoreboard pressure of a 409 target

holed out at long-on and Miller pulls off a stunner! If it's in the V, it's in the tree they say.... so long as Miller isn't fielding there. This was hit powerfully as Smith looked to take advantage of a loopy legspinner outside off, but Miller raced to his left and threw himself back at the perfect time to grab this incredible catch over this head
flatter and quicker on off stump, Ramdin keeps it out
tossed up googly outside off, defended although I'm not quite sure he picked it. Nor is Tahir
low full toss on off stump, punched to long-on

done for! Appeared to be the flipper on middle and Simmons hasn't picked it. Plunges his front leg forward to block outside the line and is struck on the front pad. But wasn't there an inside edge? Why didn't Simmons go for DRS? Huuuuge inside edge! And he didn't review it!
shortish and outside off, slammed away through the gap at point and beats third man, point and cover
back of a length on off stump, defended
darts a shortish delivery back off the deck and cuts the nervous Ramdin in half. Too quick for him too much movement as well

width on offer and Ramdin knocks it to the left of point. Thinks there's a single for the taking, but Miller races across to his left and keeps it to nothing. And the cost of that appears to be him clutching his left shoulder. Has he hurt himself?
fuller delivery on off stump, defended
flipper again on middle and Sammy jumps back to block. Manages an inside edge that could also have easily rolled onto the stumps
looped outside off and Sammy goes for the booming drive through the covers, it's the googly though so he only manages an inside edge
driven through the covers off the front foot
flighted outside off, driven into the covers
flighted on middle and leg, swept away to deep square leg
flighted outside off, driven smartly through the covers
shortish on off stump, Sammy taps it down towards point and sets off. Miller is prowling there and it could have been close had the underarm throw hit. Shoulder all okay then
stays back and guides a shortish delivery to point
back of a length and jags away from the bat, Ramdin is left groping
back of a length delivery outside off, Ramdin is not bothered with it
full on middle, Ramdin clips it to midwicket
fuller delivery on off stump, defended
flighted on off stump, defended
tossed up on off stump, pushed through the covers
brings himself forward to block a good length ball on off stump
driven to mid-on as he gets across and outside the line of this flatter ball outside off
presses forward to push the flighted delivery to cover
this time the umpire's picked up the inside edge and the lbw appeal is turned down. Loopy googly turns in and hits his pads as he looked to defend. That's drinks, by the way
back of a length on off stump, tapped into the covers
shortish and outside off, Sammy chases after it and is beaten by a hint of away swing
pokes outside his off stump and gets a thick outside edge to third man. Again that little wobble away from Steyn as he keeps the back of a length ball in the corridor
shortish and a bit wide, chopped into the covers
looks to drive a back of a length delivery that isn't there for the shot. Beaten on the bounce and the nip away from the bat
pushes away from the body to try and block, and yet Steyn's ability to get back of a length balls to move away wins out

tossed up googly on middle and leg and lures Sammy into a big slog. He's misread the wrong 'un and Tahir has beaten him between bat and pad and then sets up Quinton de Kock for a massively impressive stumping. May have been blinded by Sammy but he moved to his right, picked up the ball and removed the bails in the brief seconds before Sammy could push his overbalanced backfoot to safety
lots of turn after a good length delivery cuts back in at Russell. Defends down the wrong line and weathers a dramatic leg before appeal
slices the ball into the point region

taken! That's a second double-wicket over and South Africa are hot on the heels of anothe record - the largest margin of victory in ODIS. Three wickets to get and a cushion of 50 runs left. It was shortish and Russell backed away and cut as hard as he could. Only gets a thick outside edge to short third man, who runs forward and dives to his right and claim a good, low catch. Take a bow, Abbott
tossed up googly on off stump, driven to cover
good length ball on off stump, possibly another googly, defended
cracked off the back foot to cover, but it doesn't breach the defences of AB de Villieres
shortish on off stump, defended
gives some width and Ramdin cuts to deep point
shortish and outside off, Holder shoulders arms
back of a length and outside off, Holder doesn't want anything to do with it again
fuller delivery to try and draw Holder into a drive outside off, no such luck for Steyn
flat and short outside off, Ramdin goes back and pulls to long-on
quicker googly on middle and leg, Holder just about keeps it out on the front foot. Tahir's got four wickets and is only in his fifth over
puts that front leg away from the line and carves the flighted delivery over cover. Stunning strike
pushed the flighted delivery into the extra cover region
seemed to have picked the wrong 'un and flicks it through midwicket
shortish and outside off, it is of course the googly, cut to point
goes back to a flat delivery and clips it to deep midwicket
flighted on off stump, pushed to long-off
gets forward to block a good length ball on off stump
loopy full toss, tonked to long-on
goes deep in his crease and is nearly caught in front. Good thing he was able to bring the bat down with the flick
defends a shortish ball on off stump
googly is tossed up on middle, clipped through square leg. West Indies have caught on to Imran Tahir's "legspin"
fuller delivery on the pads, picked away to square leg
good length ball on off stump, not much turn on the legspinner as he gets off his googly, defended
looped up on off stump, driven to long-on
moves outside leg and heaves an overpitched googly over the long-off boundary. Serious strike from the West Indies captain. Can't fault him for effort
goes back and clips to square leg
bit of turn, but the length is short and it's cracked away to the left of deep point
flighted down the pads, he's tucked it to short fine leg
flighted outside off, driven smartly through the covers and he's split the gap between long-off and deep cover
whipped to deep square leg
flatter and quicker on middle, Ramdin goes back and knocks it to short midwicket

pulls all the pace off and tosses it up outside off, Ramdin reaches it and drives to the left of midwicket. Steyn is the man who seems to have dived too early. Throws his hand out and stops it, just about
flighted on off stump, driven through the covers and picks the gap. Gee, he could be good to watch when the match is actually alive
tossed up outside off, driven to point. A bit uppishly. And Holder is cramping up again
good length ball, he stays beside it and drills it through the point region
flighted on off stump, presses forward and blocks
tossed up and drifts in on off stump, Ramdin steps forward to block and gets an outside edge to third man
flighted on middle, seems to be the googly, which Ramdin picks and works to midwicket
good length ball on off stump, kept out
gets down the pitch and drives to long-on
a bit short and Ramdin tries his best to leap back and pull, but he mistimes to midwicket
better option as he jumps outside leg and cuts the shortish ball to the third man boundary to raise the West Indies hundred
tossed up on off stump, pushed down to long-on
shortish on off stump, punched to long-off
tossed up on off stump, eased to long-off
flighted on off stump, tapped back at the bowler
flighted delivery on leg stump, Ramdin goes onto one knee to sweep and gets a top edge. There is no short fine leg though, and it might not have carried anyway
good length ball on off stump, swept behind square leg
tossed up into the base of off stump, drilled to the left of long-off

through him and he has a five-for! Celebrates it with kisses blown to the heavens and South Africa are playing the perfect game. This is a flighted googly that slips through Ramdin's defences as he plays all around it
back of a length on off stump, blocked
moves across, like AB kept doing, to flick a shortish delivery from outside off. Thuds into the pads and Abbott appeals wildly. Holder was struck miles outside off though
fuller delivery outside off, Holder runs it down to deep third man and takes the single
opens the face and slices a back of a length ball from off stump through point
that's the slower short ball and Holder's got into the pull far too early. Gets a blow to his stomach to remind him not to do so

no, says umpire Gould and Abbott is thoroughly shocked. It appeared very close, after the near-yorker curled in sharply to strike Holder on his boots. There may have been an inside edge, the batsman was raising his bat. The bowler checks with his captain, but there is no decision to go for the review. If there wasn't any bat involved and there wasn't, it was gone. Another review missed, another umpiring error
quicker delivery on off stump, barely kept out
beautifully tossed up outside off and it turns sharply away from the driving Taylor
tossed up outside off, Taylor plays a cover drive having not picked it as the googly
that time he did size the googly up and blocks a fuller ball on off stump
loop, drift in, turn away and the batsman left groping. Delicious leg spin bowling
tossed up on off stump, pushed back at the bowler and Tahir bolsters his five-for with a maiden
banged in short and a shade outside off, Holder sways out of the way
fuller delivery, drilled through the covers
low full toss, that curls in quite late as well. Taylor is able to put his feet out of the way and clip it, one-handed, through wide mid-on
shortish and outside off gets a mistimed pull as the answer. Doesnt go beyond the inner circle

point was running back, third man was running in. A call needed to be made, but it hadn't come and Taylor is able to get away with a thick outside edge that flew over the cordon. Length ball gets Taylor playing wildly
fuller delivery pushed down to mid-on
rippling wrong 'un, goes back and clips the ball through midwicket
tossed up outside off and Holder scythes the ball through cover point. One more run to avoid the worst defeat in ODI cricket
lands a yorker on off stump and keeps Taylor quiet

misjudged by point! That was a catch as well! Tayloe goes against the turn for a swipe over the leg side and Abbott is running back, head craned back to keep his eyes on the ball, he turns around his left side to run back and that's his mistake. Loses speed, loses distance, loses the chance
flighted outside off, Holder stays beside the ball and lifts it over extra cover. Big, booming strike to try and save West Indies some blushes
length ball, he gets under it and slogs over the long-on boundary. Miles over it
fuller delivery outside off, bunted to mid-on off the bottom of the bat

goes short, it's a top edge and it too lands safely! Rossouw was running back from square leg and dives headlong after the ball, Tahir was running up from long leg. Bisects them. But Taylor was nowhere near in control of this terrific short ball. Rose above his eyeline and did not give him the room to free his arms
full on off stump, pushed to mid-on
shortish and outside off, that time he had the room to work with and Holder nails a pull to the midwicket boundary. Big man, lots of power
full toss, with a little inswing. Clipped to the of deep square leg and picks up a couple
fuller delivery outside off, caressed into the covers for a quick single
back of a length and outside off, looks to guide it to third man and misses
beaten outside off again as this is a back of a length delivery nibbles away
shortish and outside off, punched through the covers to bring up his fifty. Raises his bat, but there is no cheer in him
banged in short on middle, Holder ducks under it

fuller delivery outside off, hammered over extra cover like a top-order bat! Well, he does have a Test ton to his name and shots like that are the reason why. Got forward to the pitch of this ball and creamed it
fuller delivery outside off and Taylor's shown he loves to drive on the up. Lifts it over extra cover and Rossouw catches up with it right on the edge of the boundary. Good sliding save
back of a length on off stump, Taylor defends
What. A. Shot! Pressed forward and took a length ball from outside off and smeared it over the extra cover boundary. If every brutality is elegant, it's Jason Holder
fuller delivery on off stump, kept out
moves away and tries to pull a shortish delivery that was following him and skews a catch to mid-on. Had tried to make room to open up the off side but Steyn had spotted it and bested him.
goes short on leg stump and Benn tucks his head under his shoulders and swings his bat only to protect himself from getting hit in the chest
shortish on off stump, pulls past square leg

pops up to slip and that's done! Joint biggest defeat in World Cup! It was short and on Benn's body, he can't get away from it and pulls his hands up to try and block. Only ends up sliding it to the slip fielder
